title: Friction - block accelerating down a ramp

content.question: A <math alttext="1.5 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.5</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></math> block is held at rest near the top of a rough incline that makes an angle of <math alttext="37 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mn>37</mn><mo>âˆ˜</mo></msup></math> from the horizontal. The block is then released and starts moving with a constant acceleration. When the block travels <math alttext="2.0 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2.0</mn><mtext> m</mtext></math>, its velocity is <math alttext="4.0 meters per second " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.0</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>. The coefficient of kinetic friction between the surface of the incline and the block is most nearly

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
